intro: Crotalaria orixensis var. naikii, commonly known as the Orixon's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its efficacy.
